019package org.apache.shiro.hazelcast.cache;
020
021import com.hazelcast.config.Config;
022import com.hazelcast.core.Hazelcast;
023import com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance;
024import org.apache.shiro.ShiroException;
025import org.apache.shiro.cache.Cache;
026import org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheException;
027import org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheManager;
028import org.apache.shiro.cache.MapCache;
029import org.apache.shiro.util.Destroyable;
030import org.apache.shiro.util.Initializable;
031import org.slf4j.Logger;
032import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
033
034import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle;
035import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles;
036import java.lang.invoke.MethodType;
037import java.util.Map;
038
039/**
040 * A {@code CacheManager} implementation backed by <a href="http://www.hazelcast.com/">Hazelcast</a>,
041 * &quot;an open source clustering and highly scalable data distribution platform for Java&quot;
042 * <p/>
043 * This implementation interacts with a {@link HazelcastInstance} to
044 * {@link HazelcastInstance#getMap(String) acquire} named {@link java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap ConcurrentMap}
045 * instances.  Those clustered/distributed Map instances are then wrapped and made available to {@code CacheManager}
046 * callers as {@link MapCache} instances via {@link #getCache(String)}.
047 * <h2>Configuration</h2>
048 * This implementation's backing {@code HazelcastInstance} can be configured in one of three ways:
049 * <ol>
050 * <li>Doing nothing and leveraging default Hazelcast configuration mechanisms</li>
051 * <li>Supplying an already-existing {@code HazelcastInstance}</li>
052 * <li>Supplying a {@link Config} instance and using that to create a new {@code HazelcastInstance}</li>
053 * </ol>
054 * <h3>Default Configuration</h3>
055 * If you simply instantiate a {@code HazelcastCacheManager} and do nothing further, its backing
056 * {@link HazelcastInstance} instance will be created automatically by calling
057 * {@link Hazelcast#newHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.config.Config) Hazelcast.newHazelcastInstance(null)}.
058 * <p/>
059 * The null argument instructs Hazelcast to use whatever default configuration mechanism it has at its disposal,
060 * usually a {@code hazelcast.xml} file at the root of the classpath, or if that is not present, the
061 * {@code hazelcast-default.xml} file contained in the Hazelcast {@code .jar} file itself.
062 * <p/>
063 * <h3>An existing {@code HazelcastInstance}</h3>
064 * If you have created a {@code HazelcastInstance} outside of Shiro's knowledge/control, you can simply configure it
065 * to be used by calling {@link #setHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance) setHazelcastInstance}.
066 * <p/>
067 * <h3>A {@link Config} instance</h3>
068 * If you do not want to use the above two options, you can have programmatic control over all of Hazelcast's
069 * configuration by <a href="http://www.hazelcast.com/docs/2.5/manual/multi_html/ch12.html">creating and configuring a
070 * Config instance</a>.
071 * <p/>
072 * Once constructed, you can set it via {@link #setConfig(com.hazelcast.config.Config) setConfig(config)}. This config
073 * instance will be used to acquire a new Hazelcast instance by calling
074 * {@link Hazelcast#newHazelcastInstance(Config) Hazelcast.newHazelcastInstance(config)}
075 *
076 * @see <a href="http://www.hazelcast.com/docs/2.5/manual/multi_html/ch12.html">Hazelcast Configuration Documentation</a>
077 * @since 1.3
078 */
079public class HazelcastCacheManager implements CacheManager, Initializable, Destroyable {
080
081    private static final Class<?> IMAP_CLASS;
082
083    private static final MethodType GET_MAP_METHOD_TYPE;
084
085    static {
086        Class<?> klazz;
087        try {
088            klazz = HazelcastCacheManager.class.getClassLoader().loadClass( "com.hazelcast.core.IMap" );
089        } catch ( ClassNotFoundException e1 ) {
090            try {
091                klazz = HazelcastCacheManager.class.getClassLoader().loadClass( "com.hazelcast.map.IMap" );
092            } catch ( ClassNotFoundException e2 ) {
093                throw new IllegalStateException("Could not find Hazelcast v3 or v4 on classpath");
094            }
095        }
096        IMAP_CLASS = klazz;
097        GET_MAP_METHOD_TYPE = MethodType.methodType( IMAP_CLASS, String.class );
098    }
099
100    public static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(HazelcastCacheManager.class);
101
102    private boolean implicitlyCreated = false;
103    private HazelcastInstance hazelcastInstance;
104    private Config config;
105
106    /**
107     * Returns a {@link MapCache} instance representing the named Hazelcast-managed
108     * {@link com.hazelcast.core.IMap IMap}.  The Hazelcast Map is obtained by calling
109     * {@link HazelcastInstance#getMap(String) hazelcastInstance.getMap(name)}.
110     *
111     * @param name the name of the cache to acquire.
112     * @param <K> the type of map key
113     * @param <V> the type of map value
114     * @return a {@link MapCache} instance representing the named Hazelcast-managed {@link com.hazelcast.core.IMap IMap}.
115     * @throws CacheException
116     * @see HazelcastInstance#getMap(String)
117     * @see #ensureHazelcastInstance()
118     *
119     */
120    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
121    public <K, V> Cache<K, V> getCache(String name) throws CacheException {
122        try {
123            MethodHandle getMapHandle = MethodHandles
124                    .lookup().bind(ensureHazelcastInstance(), "getMap", GET_MAP_METHOD_TYPE);
125            Map<K, V> map = (Map) getMapHandle.invoke(name); //returned map is a ConcurrentMap
126            return new MapCache<>(name, map);
127        } catch (Throwable e) {
128            throw new CacheException("Unable to get IMap", e);
129        }
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * Ensures that this implementation has a backing {@link HazelcastInstance}, and if not, implicitly creates one
134     * via {@link #createHazelcastInstance()}.
135     *
136     * @return the backing (potentially newly created) {@code HazelcastInstance}.
137     * @see #createHazelcastInstance()
138     * @see HazelcastInstance
139     */
140    protected HazelcastInstance ensureHazelcastInstance() {
141        if (this.hazelcastInstance == null) {
142            this.hazelcastInstance = createHazelcastInstance();
143            this.implicitlyCreated = true;
144        }
145        return this.hazelcastInstance;
146    }
147
148    /**
149     * Initializes this instance by {@link #ensureHazelcastInstance() ensuring} there is a backing
150     * {@link HazelcastInstance}.
151     *
152     * @throws ShiroException
153     * @see #ensureHazelcastInstance()
154     * @see HazelcastInstance
155     */
156    public void init() throws ShiroException {
157        ensureHazelcastInstance();
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Implicitly creates and returns a new {@link HazelcastInstance} that will be used to back this implementation.
162     * This implementation calls:
163     * <pre>
164     * return Hazelcast.newHazelcastInstance(this.config);
165     * </pre>
166     * using any {@link #setConfig(com.hazelcast.config.Config) configured} {@code Config} object.  If no config
167     * object has been specified, {@code this.config} will be {@code null}, thereby using Hazelcast's
168     * <a href="http://www.hazelcast.com/docs/2.5/manual/multi_html/ch12.html">default configuration mechanism</a>.
169     * <p/>
170     * Can be overridden by subclasses for custom creation behavior.
171     *
172     * @return a new {@link HazelcastInstance} that will be used to back this implementation
173     * @see Hazelcast#newHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.config.Config)
174     * @see Config
175     */
176    protected HazelcastInstance createHazelcastInstance() {
177        return Hazelcast.newHazelcastInstance(this.config);
178    }
179
180    //needed for unit tests only - not part of Shiro's public API
181
182    /**
183     * NOT PART OF SHIRO'S ACCESSIBLE API.  DO NOT DEPEND ON THIS.  This method was added for testing purposes only.
184     * <p/>
185     * Returns {@code true} if this {@code HazelcastCacheManager} instance implicitly created the backing
186     * {@code HazelcastInstance}, or {@code false} if one was externally provided via
187     * {@link #setHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance) setHazelcastInstance}.
188     *
189     * @return {@code true} if this {@code HazelcastCacheManager} instance implicitly created the backing
190     *         {@code HazelcastInstance}, or {@code false} if one was externally provided via
191     *         {@link #setHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance) setHazelcastInstance}.
192     */
193    protected final boolean isImplicitlyCreated() {
194        return this.implicitlyCreated;
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Destroys any {@link #ensureHazelcastInstance() implicitly created} backing {@code HazelcastInstance}.  If the
199     * backing Hazelcast was not implicitly created (i.e. because it was configured externally and supplied via
200     * {@link #setHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance) setHazelcastInstance}), this method does
201     * nothing.
202     *
203     * @throws Exception if there is a problem shutting down
204     */
205    public void destroy() throws Exception {
206        if (this.implicitlyCreated) {
207            try {
208                this.hazelcastInstance.getLifecycleService().shutdown();
209            } catch (Throwable t) {
210                if (log.isWarnEnabled()) {
211                    log.warn("Unable to cleanly shutdown implicitly created HazelcastInstance.  " +
212                            "Ignoring (shutting down)...", t);
213                }
214            } finally {
215                this.hazelcastInstance = null;
216                this.implicitlyCreated = false;
217            }
218        }
219    }
220
221    /**
222     * Returns the {@code HazelcastInstance} from which named {@link java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap ConcurrentMap}
223     * instances will be acquired to create {@link MapCache} instances.
224     *
225     * @return the {@code HazelcastInstance} from which named {@link java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap ConcurrentMap}
226     *         instances will be acquired to create {@link MapCache} instances.
227     */
228    public HazelcastInstance getHazelcastInstance() {
229        return hazelcastInstance;
230    }
231
232    /**
233     * Sets the {@code HazelcastInstance} from which named {@link java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap ConcurrentMap}
234     * instances will be acquired to create {@link MapCache} instances.
235     *
236     * @param hazelcastInstance the {@code HazelcastInstance} from which named
237     *                          {@link java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap ConcurrentMap} instances will be acquired to create
238     *                          {@link MapCache} instances.
239     */
240    public void setHazelcastInstance(HazelcastInstance hazelcastInstance) {
241        this.hazelcastInstance = hazelcastInstance;
242    }
243
244    /**
245     * Returns the Hazelcast {@code Config} object to use to create a backing {@code HazelcastInstance} if one is not
246     * {@link #setHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance) supplied}, or {@code null} if the
247     * default <a href="http://www.hazelcast.com/docs/2.5/manual/multi_html/ch12.html">Hazelcast configuration
248     * mechanisms</a> will be used.
249     *
250     * @return the Hazelcast {@code Config} object to use to create a backing {@code HazelcastInstance} if one is not
251     *         {@link #setHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance) supplied}, or {@code null} if the
252     *         default <a href="http://www.hazelcast.com/docs/2.5/manual/multi_html/ch12.html">Hazelcast configuration
253     *         mechanisms</a> will be used.
254     * @see Hazelcast#newHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.config.Config)
255     */
256    public Config getConfig() {
257        return config;
258    }
259
260    /**
261     * Sets the Hazelcast {@code Config} object to use to create a backing {@code HazelcastInstance} if one is not
262     * {@link #setHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance) supplied}.  {@code null} can be set if the
263     * default <a href="http://www.hazelcast.com/docs/2.5/manual/multi_html/ch12.html">Hazelcast configuration
264     * mechanisms</a> will be used.
265     *
266     * @param config the Hazelcast {@code Config} object to use to create a backing {@code HazelcastInstance} if one is not
267     *               {@link #setHazelcastInstance(com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance) supplied}, or {@code null} if the
268     *               default <a href="http://www.hazelcast.com/docs/2.5/manual/multi_html/ch12.html">Hazelcast configuration
269     *               mechanisms</a> will be used.
270     */
271    public void setConfig(Config config) {
272        this.config = config;
273    }
274
275}
